abstract_problem: A district heating and power operator manages a fleet of Combined Heat and Power (CHP) and thermal units to supply district energy demand. The planning horizon consists of T=168 consecutive time intervals (1 week). Each unit has specific operating modes with distinct thermal and electrical output capabilities. The operator must satisfy the district's energy demand while maintaining a thermal reserve margin. Operational constraints include minimum runtime/downtime and boiler ignition/shutdown logic. All cost data is provided in Euros (EUR), but the operator's financial reporting and objective function must be calculated in US Dollars (USD).

units.description:
Registry of thermal assets. Contains string identifiers and metadata.
- `unit_id`: Unique string identifier (e.g., 'DH_UNIT_001').
- `manufacturer`: Asset manufacturer (decoy).
- `commission_year`: Year of commissioning (decoy).
- `thermal_efficiency_class`: Efficiency rating (decoy).

mode_specs.description:
Technical specifications for asset operating modes.
- `unit_id`: Asset identifier.
- `mode_id`: Mode identifier.
- `min_output`: Minimum power output (MW).
- `max_output`: Maximum power output (MW).

mode_costs.description:
Economic parameters for asset operating modes in EUR. Note: Marginal and fixed costs are zero here; actual production costs are modeled via `operating_cost_segments.csv`.
- `unit_id`: Asset identifier.
- `mode_id`: Mode identifier.
- `marginal_cost`: Cost per unit of output (EUR/MW) (placeholder).
- `fixed_cost`: Hourly fixed cost when active (EUR/h) (placeholder).

operating_cost_segments.description:
Piecewise linear production cost segments for units in EUR. Each row defines a cost segment: cost (EUR) >= slope * generation + intercept * mode_on.
- `unit_id`: Asset identifier.
- `mode_id`: Mode identifier.
- `time_id`: Time interval index (1-168).
- `segment_id`: Segment identifier.
- `slope`: Marginal cost for this segment (EUR/MW).
- `intercept`: Fixed cost component for this segment (EUR/h).

system_requirements.description:
District energy demand and reserve requirements per time interval.
- `time_id`: Time interval index (1-168).
- `demand`: System load (MW).
- `spinning_reserve_requirement`: Required thermal reserve (MW).

policy_rules.description:
Operational policy rules defining constraints.
- `rule_id`: Unique rule identifier.
- `rule_family`: Business category of the rule. Possible values:
  - `DISTRICT_HEAT_BALANCE`: Supply must equal demand.
  - `THERMAL_RESERVE_REQ`: Reserve capacity requirement.
  - `MINIMUM_RUNTIME_CONSTRAINT`: Minimum uptime constraint.
  - `MINIMUM_COOLDOWN_CONSTRAINT`: Minimum downtime constraint.
  - `BOILER_IGNITION_LOGIC`: Logic linking startup to online status.
  - `BOILER_SHUTDOWN_LOGIC`: Logic linking shutdown to online status.
  - `OPERATIONAL_STATE_TRANSITION`: Logic governing state transitions.
  - `INITIAL_STATE_PATCH`: Initial condition constraints.
- `time_id`: Time interval index.
- `sense`: Comparison operator (`<=`, `=`, `>=`).
- `rhs`: Right-hand side value.

policy_rule_terms.description:
Detailed terms for policy rules.
- `rule_id`: Link to `policy_rules.csv`.
- `term_type`: Variable type. Possible values:
  - `ONLINE`: Binary variable indicating unit is online.
  - `START`: Binary variable indicating unit start.
  - `STOP`: Binary variable indicating unit stop.
  - `STOP_STAGE`: Binary variable for stop stage logic.
  - `START_STAGE`: Binary variable for start stage logic.
  - `STARTUP_COST`: Continuous variable for startup cost.
  - `UNSERVED`: Continuous variable for unserved energy (load shedding).
  - `GEN`: Continuous variable for power generation (implicit in some rules).
  - `MODE_ON`: Binary variable indicating specific mode is active (implicit in some rules).
- `time_id`: Time interval index.
- `coef`: Coefficient.

mode_unavailability_windows.description: Periods where specific asset modes are unavailable.

start_stop_event_cost_windows.description:
Time windows for activation/deactivation surcharges in EUR.
- `event_cost`: Cost per event (EUR).

ambient_conditions.description: Environmental data (temperature, wind speed) for demand forecasting (decoy).

asset_registry.description: Additional asset metadata including location and maintenance (decoy).
